Discussing his boss with New! magazine, Dermot O'Leary praised Simon Cowell for having time for everyone. Simon Cowell is a remarkably surprising, down-to-earth man, he said.`` You don't get that level of success if you haven't got a touch of normality.`` He's very much a common man, someone you could go for a beer

I don't have to do nuttin'. I'm still going to be me. I'm still going to play my game, still play with confidence, still try to rally the guys around me, and make sure they're focused and in tune with what we're doing, what we're trying to accomplish, Michael Vick said.`` That's what's important. You can't change your game around this time of the season... You just go out and play your best football. It's the playoffs.''

Andy Coulson was employed by David Cameron to improve the Conservative Party's media operation in the run-up to the May 2010 election. I am very sorry that Andy Coulson has decided to resign as my director of communications, although I understand that the continuing pressures on him and his family mean that he feels compelled to do so, David Cameron said in an e-mailed statement.`` Andy Coulson has told me that the focus on him was impeding his ability to do his job and was starting to prove a distraction for the government.''
